abstract.text: A distance or position in 3D space.

inlineContent.text: Euclid doesn’t have a 2D vector type. When working with primarily 2D shapes, such as
component when constructing vector and it will default to zero.

abstract.text: Euclid is a library for creating and manipulating 3D geometry using techniques such as extruding or “lathing” 2D paths to create solid 3D shapes, and CSG (Constructive Solid Geometry) to combine or subtract those shapes from one another.
An axially-aligned bounding box in 3D space.
A color in RGBA format.
A 3D surface made of polygons.
A path made up of a sequence of straight line segments between points.
An infinite 2D plane in 3D space.
A polygon in 3D space.
A distance or position in 3D space.
